body_content.explanation: to turn a piece of electronic equipment off and then on again when it does not work correctly, to make it start working correctly again:
examples: You can reset most routers by holding down the reset button for 30 seconds.

body_content.explanation: to change the position on the controls of a piece of equipment:
examples: I had to reset the clock on the microwave.
There is no need to reset the thermostat in the summer.

body_content.explanation: to change the details of something:
examples: You may need to reset your password.

body_content.explanation: of a machine or piece of equipment, to turn off and then on again and return to its original settings:
examples: The monitor resets automatically when a new cartridge is installed.
The circuit-breaker will automatically reset within 15 seconds if no serious damage occurred.

body_content.explanation: to change so as to be at a different level, amount, or time:
examples: Borrowers began having trouble as their interest rates reset higher.
The system resets every leap year.

body_content.explanation: of a person, to start again after a period of rest or change, so that you feel better able to deal with your life or with a situation :
examples: Covid-19 has provided many people with an opportunity to reset.
Longer intervals between deployments would allow soldiers better opportunities to reset mentally before returning to combat.

body_content.explanation: the act of returning a piece of equipment to its original settings, usually by turning it off and on again:
examples: A hard reset will erase all of the device's applications.
The unit may require a full-system reset .

body_content.explanation: the act of changing the details of something:
examples: As soon as we learned of the attack, we forced password resets on all affected accounts.

body_content.explanation: the act of changing something so it is at a different level, amount, or time:
examples: We should anticipate a reset of tax rates.
Some homeowners are facing resets on adjustable-rate mortgages.
